verses.text_plain: The wilderness and the solitary place shall be glad for them; and the desert shall rejoice, and blossom as the rose.
verses.verse_html: 1The wilderness and the solitary place shall be glad for them; and the desert shall rejoice, and blossom as the rose.

verses.text_plain: It shall blossom abundantly, and rejoice even with joy and singing: the glory of Lebanon shall be given unto it, the excellency of Carmel and Sharon, they shall see the glory of the Lord, and the excellency of our God.
verses.verse_html: 2It shall blossom abundantly, and rejoice even with joy and singing: the glory of Lebanon shall be given unto it, the excellency of Carmel and Sharon, they shall see the glory of the Lord, and the excellency of our God.

verses.text_plain: Strengthen ye the weak hands, and confirm the feeble knees.
verses.verse_html: 3Strengthen ye the weak hands, and confirm the feeble knees.

verses.text_plain: Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you.
verses.verse_html:
4Say to them that are of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come with vengeance, even God with a recompence; he will come and save you. ▼
▼ fearful: Heb. hasty

verses.text_plain: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
verses.verse_html: 5Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.

verses.text_plain: Then shall the lame man leap as an hart, and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert.
verses.verse_html: 6Then shall the lame man leap as an hart, and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert.

verses.text_plain: And the parched ground shall become a pool, and the thirsty land springs of water: in the habitation of dragons, where each lay, shall be grass with reeds and rushes.
verses.verse_html:
7And the parched ground shall become a pool, and the thirsty land springs of water: in the habitation of dragons, where each lay, shall be grass with reeds and rushes. ▼
▼ grass…: or, a court for reeds, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ grass…: or, a court for reeds, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ grass…: or, a court for reeds, etc

verses.text_plain: And an highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called The way of holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; but it shall be for those: the wayfaring men, though fools, shall not err therein.
verses.verse_html:
8And an highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called The way of holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; but it shall be for those: the wayfaring men, though fools, shall not err therein. ▼
▼ but…: or, for he shall be with them

tokens.text: shall be there, and a way

footnotes.body_text: ▼ but…: or, for he shall be with them
footnotes.body_html: ▼ but…: or, for he shall be with them

verses.text_plain: No lion shall be there, nor any ravenous beast shall go up thereon, it shall not be found there; but the redeemed shall walk there:
verses.verse_html: 9No lion shall be there, nor any ravenous beast shall go up thereon, it shall not be found there; but the redeemed shall walk there:

tokens.text: thereon, it shall not be found

verses.text_plain: And the ransomed of the Lord shall return, and come to Zion with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads: they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
verses.verse_html: 10And the ransomed of the Lord shall return, and come to Zion with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads: they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.
